As in 'that montaign there' The ton of this word depends on the ton of the word it is attached to. Hence, it can be a hight ton, a middle, or a low one.

language: East Sumbanese, Umbu Ratu Nggai dialect

language: Kadazan Dusun of Taginambur, Kota Belud, Sabah, Malaysia

annotation: many many forms,+ inflected for person
object is far from both the speaker and the listener
1. The one, that one (relatively far from the speaker and hearer, remote, usually out of sight of the hearer and the speaker)
2. The one, that one (the topic is not far from the hearer)
3. THe one, that one (close to the hearer)
4. That (topic is relatively far from the the speaker and hearer or out of sight, remote)
5. That (topic is closer to the hearer or on the hearer's person)
6. That (topic is far from speaker but almost within reach of the hearer)
Used for close to the speaker participants
Used for far away from the speaker participants
vowel tones assimilates to the preceding V
Source- ACD: demonstrative: this, that, there, another,
(most common and inuitive… see annotation for "this")
